I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

exds_int = fun (m : fmap) (z : dart) (a b : nat) (s : set) => forall i : nat, (a <= i <= b)%nat -> exds s (Iter (f m) i z) : fmap -> dart -> nat -> nat -> set -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ _ nat_scope nat_scope _]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Inductive set : Set := Vs : set | Is : set -> dart -> set
dart = nat : Set

diff_int_dec : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart) (a b : nat), {diff_int m z a b} + {~ diff_int m z a b}
diff_int = fun (m : fmap) (z : dart) (a b : nat) => forall i j : nat, (a <= i)%nat /\ (i < j <= b)%nat -> Iter (f m) i z <> Iter (f m) j z : fmap -> dart -> nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ _ nat_scope nat_scope]
diff_int_aux = fun (m : fmap) (z : dart) (a b : nat) (t : dart) => forall i : nat, (a <= i <= b)%nat -> Iter (f m) i z <> t : fmap -> dart -> nat -> nat -> dart -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ _ nat_scope nat_scope _]
card_rem_aux : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart) (s : set), (card s < ndN m)%nat -> (card (Iter_rem_aux m z s) < ndN m)%nat
LQ2 : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart) (s : set), exds s (Iter (f m) (ndN m - card s) z) -> (card (Iter_rem_aux m z s) < card s)%nat
LR1 : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart) (i : nat) (s : set), let sr := Iter_rem_aux m z s in let n := Iter_upb_aux m z s in (ndN m - card s <= i <= n)%nat -> ~ exds sr (Iter (f m) i z)
card_rem_aux_bis : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart) (s : set), (card s <= ndN m)%nat -> (card (Iter_rem_aux m z s) <= ndN m)%nat
LR3 : forall (m : fmap) (z t : dart) (s : set), ~ exds s t -> let sr := Iter_rem_aux m z s in ~ exds sr t
ex_i_aux : forall (m : fmap) (z t : dart) (s : set), inv_hmap m -> exd m z -> exds s t -> (card s <= ndN m)%nat -> let sr := Iter_rem_aux m z s in let nr := Iter_upb_aux m z s in ~ exds sr t -> {i : nat | (i < nr)%nat /\ Iter (f m) i z = t}

exds_card_pos : forall (s : set) (z : dart), exds s z -> (0 < card s)%nat

R1 = fun (m : fmap) (z : dart) (i : nat) (s : set) => let sr := Iter_rem_aux m z s in let n := Iter_upb_aux m z s in (ndN m - card s <= i <= n)%nat -> ~ exds sr (Iter (f m) i z) : fmap -> dart -> nat -> set -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ _ nat_scope _]
upb_pos_aux : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart), exd m z -> (card (Iter_rem m z) < ndN m)%nat

exds_Iter_f_i : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart) (i : nat), inv_hmap m -> exd m z -> let s := Iter_orb m z in let n := Iter_upb m z in (i <= n)%nat -> exds s (Iter (f m) i z)
